title: Impact of corporate earnings reports on Colliers International Group Inc stock's price movements

content.text: Colliers International Group Inc released its Q2 2021 earnings report on July 27, 2021. The report showed strong financial performance, with revenue of $946 million, representing an increase of 37% year-over-year. The company also reported adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $1.20, surpassing analysts' expectations. This positive earnings report led to an immediate increase in Colliers International Group Inc's stock price by 5% on the following trading day.

On April 27, 2021, Colliers International Group Inc announced its Q1 2021 earnings report. The report revealed that the company generated revenue of $829 million, a growth of 19% compared to the same quarter last year. Additionally, the adjusted EPS stood at $0.90, exceeding analysts' estimates. The market responded positively to these strong results, pushing Colliers International Group Inc's stock price up by 8% in the days following the earnings release.

Colliers International Group Inc shared its Q4 2020 earnings report on February 9, 2021. The report demonstrated solid financial performance, recording revenue of $852 million, a 9% increase year-over-year. The adjusted EPS for the quarter was reported at $1.15, surpassing market expectations. As a result, Colliers International Group Inc's stock price experienced a significant surge of 12% within a week of the earnings release.

The Q3 2020 earnings report for Colliers International Group Inc was published on October 27, 2020. The company reported revenue of $695 million for the quarter, representing a decline of 5% compared to the same period in the previous year. However, the adjusted EPS came in at $0.76, which beat analysts' estimates. Despite the slight drop in revenue, the positive earnings surprise led to a 4% increase in Colliers International Group Inc's stock price shortly after the report was released.

On July 28, 2020, Colliers International Group Inc announced its Q2 2020 earnings report. The report highlighted the challenges faced due to the COVID-19 pandemic, with revenue declining by 24% year-over-year to $444 million. The adjusted EPS for the quarter was reported at $0.30, below analysts' expectations. Consequently, Colliers International Group Inc's stock price dropped by 8% in the days following the earnings release.

Colliers International Group Inc released its Q1 2020 earnings report on April 28, 2020, during the early stages of the COVID-19 pandemic. The report showed a modest decrease in revenue, amounting to $624 million, a decline of 7% compared to the previous year. The adjusted EPS for the quarter stood at $0.68, which was in line with analysts' expectations. The stock price of Colliers International Group Inc remained relatively stable after the earnings report, reflecting the uncertain market conditions caused by the pandemic.

Overall, the impact of corporate earnings reports on Colliers International Group Inc's stock price movements has been significant. Positive earnings surprises, such as in Q2 2021, Q1 2021, and Q4 2020, resulted in considerable increases in the stock price. Conversely, instances where earnings fell short of expectations, such as in Q2 2020, led to notable declines in the stock price. It is essential for investors to closely monitor these earnings reports as they provide valuable insights into the company's financial performance and influence stock market reactions.
